intro: Cirsium pseudosuffultum, commonly known as the purplestem thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, hairy stems and large, purple to pinkish-purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped with rough, serrated edges, and the flowers are arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Cirsium pseudosuffultum is often found in elevations ranging from 1,500 to 6,000 feet.
